Reviews.Content: Perfect for insomniacs Was a bit dubious of the 'free earplugs' in reception, and rightly so. This is easily the noisiest place i have ever stayed - and I used to live under the flight path for Heathrow!.. If having a club below your feet, booming out a continual bass line until 6am is not bad enough, then wait for the binmen to empty the trash!! Add to that the fact Kings Cross is the seediest, dirtiest place in what is otherwise a beautiful city, and you will see that my advice is DON'T STAY HERE!
Reviews.Author: mnicol10

Reviews.Content: what a mixed bag! as other reviews have mentioned and i ignored at my peril, if you are staying at this hotel either a) dont stay at a weekend or b) ask for a room thats soundproof!the nightclub belows noise isnt too bad, its the line and people hanging around outside thats the problem. the funny thing is you wouldnt even know the clubs there till the evening. its just a doorway then sometime after 10pm the red carpet and crowd barrier comes out! i was kept awake till 6am saturday and sunday morning and 5am on monday. even as an ex clubber my patience was soon running out due to sleep deprevation and due to my budget i was stuck there.to be fair to the hotel the rooms are very nice.
Reviews.Author: SheffieldJose

Reviews.Content: Clean,Comfortable,  Great Central location for My sister and I's weekend in Sydney! Easy to get to the clubs as expected being in Kings Cross, but also very close to beautiful rushcutters bay park, the city for shopping and Bondi. The train station was just a quick walk up the road.The rooms were fantastic for the $ we paid, very clean, and well thought out. Great TV, DVD player, and very stylish!
Reviews.Author: Rhyanna

Reviews.Content: YOU MAY ASWELL BE IN THE CLUB!!!!! Stayed on Saturday night - expected a bit of noise as it is Kings Cross!! At check in they offered us EAR PLUGS, not a good sign. Didn't get much sleep at all because Lady Lux (a nightclub open til 6am) was underneath us and the base THUMPED ALL NIGHT LONG. Unless you sleep like a log - forget it!!
Reviews.Author: ceeonz

Reviews.Content: Not good Talk about misleading advertising! It is right in the heart of Kings Cross, but the rest of the advertising is misleading. I booked a suite for AUD$104, but am very sceptical whether I was given the room advertised. The windows could not lock, the cleaning was not done, used towels were not replaced, but just refolded, the tap in the bathroom wobbled all over the place, the room was much smaller than advertised. On the positive side - it did have a fridge, coffee making, double bed, and shower that worked. It may be worth booking a Studio room at less cost, but forget the so-called suites. Formule 1 is far better value and at a cheaper price (AUD$89). I woudn't go there again.
Reviews.Author: Oz11

Reviews.Content: Barncleuth Suite - Leisure Inn Kings Cross       Room
Reviews.Author: Sangria07

Reviews.Content: Nightmare on Roslyn Street Wanting to be near my son who lives at Potts Point I rang the hotel after reading the previous review on this site. It was Queens Birthday in New Zealand and I went over on the Thursday. I had mentioned to the woman on the phone that I don't appreciate loud noise and she suggested that they would put me in a room in the centre of the hotel. From the tone used I asked if the reality was that I would be better off NOT staying at their hotel but was assured this was not the case.When I got into my room about 2.30 pm I found that it was tiny and had no shelves for clothes, never mind a wardrobe. Planning to go to the Opera House on the Friday night I needed somewhere to hang my good clothes and was respectfully re-assigned to a room at the front above the street. As with the previous review, I was asked to pay as I registered, not as normal, when checking out; the strategy surrounding this became apparent later.The noise from the street was uproarious and ear-plugs did little to lessen the effect, there was also a booming (less so in this room) from the dance-music night club immediately through the wall from the main part of the building. The club is open until 5am Th/Fri/Sat/Sun. That was the end of any sleep for me until the Monday night. There is obviously no extra baffling in the walls and no double glazing - it truly was a nightmare. I noted that the manager disappeared for the weekend, sensible her. The rooms are well appointed (other than that small one I wrote of before which could easily be solved with a standing hanging and shelf rack between the end of the bed and the sink bench).I hear they opened in January and while there are phones in the rooms they are not connected. TVs, beds, and facilities are great, if you are not suffering from sleep deprivation. When the night porter (Ali- helpful chap) helped me to move again during the middle of the night on Sunday, I found to my dismay that although the street noise was significantly lessened in the small central room, the impact of the nightclub was multiplied. It was like trying to sleep in the middle of a giant tympani, while the percussionist was still drumming.While the manager seemed intent on dismissing the reality of the noise, at least one staff member (Kaijsa) had the honesty to be embarrassed about the situation.Now you'll have guessed why they take the money upfront. Once you've spent the $500, you are much less likely to leave and go to somewhere that understands that renting a bedroom, at whatever price, is so you can SLEEP in it.With the nice rooms and beds, plus the other great facilities in the rooms, I was tempted to mark this 2 stars 'okay but with problems' but the very basic enjoyment of any of these facilities was undermined by the overwhelming noise problem, one they either can't or won't fix. Don't know how much money's left in their coffers to do it, as one whole floor is still to be opened and one would think double-glazing at least would easily repay itself.Summary: Nice rooms, beds, facilities. Location and noise management a NIGHTMARE. You may go once and even stay for the term you'll be asked to pay for at the beginning; but unless you are deaf or a masochist, I doubt whether you'll return... Maybe with a member of the NSW Tourist Bureau??? Who knows?
Reviews.Author: CoachnVee

Reviews.Content: very satisfied - new hotel / still working out some issues       tv, desk, wardrobe
Reviews.Author: peppy5
